sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using inverse matrices
message_1:
Find the solution of the system of linear equations using inverse matrices:
$$\begin{cases} 
x + 2y - 3z = -1 \\
2x - y -z = 5 \\
3x + 4y + z = 3 \\
\end{cases}$$
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using inverse matrices, we first need to write the system in matrix form AX = B, where A is the matrix of coefficients, X is the column matrix of variables, and B is the column matrix of constants.

A = $\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 & -3 \\
2 & -1 & -1 \\
3 & 4 & 1
\end{bmatrix}$, X = $\begin{bmatrix}
x \\
y \\
z
\end{bmatrix}$, B = $\begin{bmatrix}
-1 \\
5 \\
3
\end{bmatrix}$

Now, we need to find the inverse of matrix A, denoted as A⁻¹. To do this, we first find the determinant of A.

det(A) = $\begin{vmatrix}
1 & 2 & -3 \\
2 & -1 & -1 \\
3 & 4 & 1
\end{vmatrix}$ = $1\begin{vmatrix}
-1 & -1 \\
4 & 1
\end{vmatrix} - 2\begin{vmatrix}
2 & -1 \\
3 & 1
\end{vmatrix} - 3\begin{vmatrix}
2 & -1 \\
3 & 4
\end{vmatrix}$

= $1((-1)(1) - (-1)(4)) - 2((2)(1) - (-1)(3)) - 3((2)(4) - (-1)(3))$

= $1(3) - 2(7) - 3(11)$

= $3 - 14 - 33$

= $-44$

Now, we find the matrix of minors of A:

M = $\begin{bmatrix}
(-1)(1) - (-1)(4) & (2)(1) - (-1)(3) & (2)(4) - (-1)(3) \\
(2)(1) - (-1)(4) & (1)(1) - (-3)(3) & (1)(3) - (-3)(2) \\
(2)(4) - (-1)(1) & (1)(-3) - (3)(-1) & (1)(1) - (2)(3)
\end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix}
3 & 7 & 11 \\
6 & 10 & 8 \\
7 & 6 & -5
\end{bmatrix}$

Next, we find the matrix of cofactors of A:

C = $\begin{bmatrix}
3 & -7 & 11 \\
-6 & 10 & -8 \\
7 & 6 & -5
\end{bmatrix}$

Now, we find the adjugate of A (transpose of the matrix of cofactors):

adj(A) = $\begin{bmatrix}
3 & -6 & 7 \\
-7 & 10 & 6 \\
11 & -8 & -5
\end{bmatrix}$

Finally, we find the inverse of A:

A⁻¹ = $\frac{1}{det(A)}$ adj(A) = $\frac{1}{-44}$ $\begin{bmatrix}
3 & -6 & 7 \\
-7 & 10 & 6 \\
11 & -8 & -5
\end{bmatrix}$

Now, we can find the solution X by multiplying A⁻¹ with B:

X = A⁻¹B = $\frac{1}{-44}$ $\begin{bmatrix}
3 & -6 & 7 \\
-7 & 10 & 6 \\
11 & -8 & -5
\end{bmatrix}$ $\begin{bmatrix}
-1 \\
5 \\
3
\end{bmatrix}$

= $\frac{1}{-44}$ $\begin{bmatrix}
(-1)(3) + (5)(-6) + (3)(7) \\
(-1)(-7) + (5)(10) + (3)(6) \\
(-1)(11) + (5)(-8) + (3)(-5)
\end{bmatrix}$

= $\frac{1}{-44}$ $\begin{bmatrix}
-30 \\
62 \\
-54
\end{bmatrix}$

= $\begin{bmatrix}
\frac{30}{44} \\
\frac{-62}{44} \\
\frac{54}{44}
\end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix}
\frac{15}{22} \\
\frac{-31}{22} \\
\frac{27}{22}
\end{bmatrix}$

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = $\frac{15}{22}$, y = $\frac{-31}{22}$, z = $\frac{27}{22}$.
